results.name: Triangle of B-analogs of Stirling numbers of first kind.
comment: Triangle T(n,k), read by rows, given by [1, 0, 1, 0, 1, 0, 1, 0, 1, ...] DELTA [ -1, -2, -3, -4, -5, -6, -7, -8, ...], where DELTA is the operator defined in A084938. - _Philippe Deléham_, Aug 08 2005
link: Ruedi Suter, Two analogues of a classical sequence, J. Integer Sequences, Vol. 3 (2000), #P00.1.8.
example: Triangle T(n,k) (with rows n >= 0 and columns k = 0..n) begins:
